item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} - AdminStatus
item_prototype.description: ifAdminStatus OBJECT-TYPE SYNTAX INTEGER { up(1), -- ready to pass packets down(2), testing(3) -- in some test mode } MAX-ACCESS read-write STATUS current DESCRIPTION "The desired state of the interface. The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packets can be passed. When a managed system initializes, all interfaces start with ifAdminStatus in the down(2) state. As a result of either explicit management action or per configuration information retained by the managed system, ifAdminStatus is then changed to either the up(1) or testing(3) states (or remains in the down(2) state)." ::= { ifEntry 7 }

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} - OperStatus
item_prototype.description: ifOperStatus OBJECT-TYPE SYNTAX INTEGER { up(1), -- ready to pass packets down(2), testing(3), -- in some test mode unknown(4), -- status can not be determined -- for some reason. dormant(5), notPresent(6), -- some component is missing lowerLayerDown(7) -- down due to state of -- lower-layer interface(s) } MAX-ACCESS read-only STATUS current DESCRIPTION "The current operational state of the interface. The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packets can be passed. If ifAdminStatus is down(2) then ifOperStatus should be down(2). If ifAdminStatus is changed to up(1) then ifOperStatus should change to up(1) if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic; it should change to dormant(5) if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incoming connection); it should remain in the down(2) state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the up(1) state; it should remain in the notPresent(6) state if the interface has missing (typically, hardware) components

trigger_prototype.expression: ({Custom - HW - Juniper EX:Outbound_errors[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()} + {Custom - HW - Juniper EX:Inbound_errors[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}) > 0
trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} Errors > 0

trigger_prototype.expression: {Custom - HW - Juniper EX:AdminStatus[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=1 and {Custom - HW - Juniper EX:OperStatus[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}<>1
trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} interface not active, OperStatus={ITEM.VALUE2}
trigger_prototype.description: Interface should be up, but no link is active

item_prototype.name: Switch {#SNMPVALUE} - Tail Drops due to Traffic Congestion or Burst

trigger_prototype.expression: {Custom - HW - Juniper EX:jnxOperatingCPU.[{#SNMPVALUE}].min(30)}>70 and {Custom - HW - Juniper EX:jnxOperatingCPU.[{#SNMPVALUE}].min(30)}<95 and {Custom - HW - Juniper EX:jnxOperating5MinLoadAvg.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last(30)}>100 and {Custom - HW - Juniper EX:jnxOperating5MinLoadAvg.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last(0)}<300
trigger_prototype.name: {HOSTNAME} {#SNMPVALUE} - CPU usage above 70%
trigger_prototype.description: The CPU load on this node has increased to over 70%. If this is a sudden or unexpected increase, immediate investigation is advised.

trigger_prototype.name: {HOSTNAME} {#SNMPVALUE} - High CPU usage (95%)
trigger_prototype.description: The CPU load on this node has increased to over 95%. If this is a sudden or unexpected increase, immediate investigation is advised.

trigger_prototype.name: {HOSTNAME} {#SNMPVALUE} - High temperature
trigger_prototype.description:
The temperature of this switch is above 60ºC.
Please check the status of the fans and environmental conditions immediately.

trigger.expression: {Custom - HW - Juniper EX:icmpping.sum(#3)}=0 or ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=1 and {Custom - HW - Juniper EX:icmpping.sum(#3)}<>3)
trigger.name: Ping check
trigger.description:
The switch has stopped responding to ICMP echo requests, and is likely offline.
Please investigate.

trigger.name: Red Alarm
trigger.description: A red alarm is reporting on this device. Please login to the CLI and check what this alert has been caused by.

trigger.name: Yellow Alarm
trigger.description: A yellow alarm is reporting on this device. Please login to the CLI and check what this alert has been caused by.
